info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 09 at 4:14PM MDT by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Mineral County through 500 PM MDT... At 413 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Haugan, or 21 miles south of Thompson Falls, moving northwest at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half-inch size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Haugan, Saltese, East Portal and Taft. This includes Interstate 90 between mile markers 0 and 17, and between mile markers 22 and 26. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
